teams.name: Ferrari
teams.description: Founded in 1950, Ferrari is F1’s most successful and oldest team, boasting multiple championships and legendary drivers like Schumacher and Lauda.

teams.name: Mercedes
teams.description: Dominated the hybrid era (2014-2021) with Lewis Hamilton. Initially an F1 pioneer in the 1950s, it returned as a full team in 2010.

teams.name: Red Bull Racing
teams.description: Entered F1 in 2005. Became dominant with Sebastian Vettel (2010-2013) and again with Max Verstappen (2021-present), winning multiple titles.

teams.name: McLaren
teams.description: Founded in 1963, McLaren is one of F1’s most historic teams. It dominated in the 1980s and 1990s with drivers like Senna and Prost.

teams.name: Aston Martin
teams.description: Originally Racing Point, this British team revived the iconic Aston Martin brand in 2021. Backed by Lawrence Stroll, it aims for the top.

teams.name: Alpine
teams.description: Formerly Renault, this French team has roots in the 1970s. It won titles in 2005 and 2006 with Fernando Alonso. Rebranded as Alpine in 2021.

teams.name: Visa Cash App RB
teams.description: Formerly Toro Rosso (2006-2019) and AlphaTauri (2020-2023), this team develops young Red Bull drivers, with occasional surprise wins.

teams.name: Williams
teams.description: Founded in 1977, Williams is a legendary team with multiple championships, though it has struggled in recent years. Known for drivers like Mansell and Senna.

teams.name: Stake Sauber
teams.description: Originally Sauber (1993), it later became BMW Sauber (2006-2009). It returned to Sauber before becoming Alfa Romeo (2019-2023) and rebranded again in 2024.

teams.name: Haas
teams.description: The only American F1 team, founded in 2016 by Gene Haas. It has fluctuated in performance but remains a consistent midfield competitor
